manifest.OpenIDE-Module-Long-Description:
NetBeans IDE support for Apache Maven.

Maven is a software project management and comprehension tool. Based on the concept of a project object model (POM), Maven can manage a project's build, reporting and documentation from a central piece of information. To learn more about Apache Maven, visit What is Maven? page.

The IDE support includes own project type entirely based on Maven's medatata, code completion for Maven's project files, integration with other tools in the IDE etc. For details on the IDE support, visit Mevenide homepage.

manifest.OpenIDE-Module-Long-Description:
This plug-in adds the support for generating installers for module suite projects, right inside from the IDE itself. This generates installer based on openInstaller (www.openInstaller.org) installer framework.
Here's how you can generate an installer for your module suite application.
1. Configure your module suite project as 'stand alone' application. 2. Click on the toolbar button(with CD icon)/Select 'Generate Suite Installer' from Build menu/Select 'Generate Suite Installer' from the project contextual menu. This would popup a wizard. 3. Enter the basic details about your suite application on the wizard and click 'Finish'. 4. The installer generation begins and when this completes, the generated installer will be placed in 'dist' folder under the suite project folder. The name of the installer bundle file will be '<MODULE-SUITE-NAME>-binary.zip'. You can rename this to anything you want. 5. This plug-in also generates another zip file called '<MODULE-SUITE-NAME>-source.zip' which allows to customize the generated installer using openInstaller IDE application. The openInstaller IDE is a separate project and will be released soon.
